post.description:
### Description 
Creates a new Policy. The parameter `policy_id`, an identifier of Policy resources, can only include lowercase alphabets, numbers, and hyphens(-). The parameter `permissions` is a list type data describing page access permissions.

### Description 
Updates a specific Policy. You can make changes in Policy settings, including `name`, `labels`, `tags`, and `permissions`. The parameter `policy_id` cannot be updated.

### Description 
Deletes a specific Policy. You must specify the `policy_id` of the Policy to delete, as the `policy_id` is an identifier of Policy resources.

### Description 
Gets a specific Policy. You must specify the `policy_id` of the Policy to get, as the `policy_id` is an identifier of Policy resources. You can use the parameter `repository_id` to limit the scope of the method to a specific Repository.

### Description 
Gets a list of all Policies in a specific Repository. The parameter `repository_id` is used as an identifier of a Repository to get its list of Policies. You can use a query to get a filtered list of Policies.
### Description

### Description 
Gets a specific Repository. Prints detailed information about the Repository, including  `name`, `repository_type`, and `endpoint`.

### Description 
Gets a list of all Repositories regardless of `domain`. You can use a query to get a filtered list of Repositories.
### Description

### Description 
Registers a Plugin. The parameter `registry_type`, meaning container registry type, can be either `DOCKER_HUB` or `AWS_PRIVATE_ECR`. The default value of the `registry_type` is `DOCKER_HUB`. The parameter `registry_url` is required if the `registry_type` is not `DOCKER_HUB`. The parameter `image` is limited to 40 characters.

requestBody.description: | Key | Description | Type | Required| |-------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------|-----------|-------| |name||string|True| |service_type||string|True| |image||string|True| |domain_id||string|True| |provider||string|| |registry_type|DOCKER_HUB, AWS_PRIVATE_ECR, HARBOR |string|| |registry_config||Struct|| |capability||Struct|| |template||Struct|| |labels||array|| |tags||Struct|| |project_id||string||

post.description:
### Description 
Updates a specific Plugin registered. A Plugin can be updated only if its Repository's `repository_type` is `local`. You can make changes in Plugin settings, including `template` and its options, `schema`.

### Description 
Deregisters and deletes a specific Plugin. You must specify the `plugin_id` of the Plugin to deregister.

### Description 
Enables a specific Plugin. If the Plugin is enabled, the Plugin can be used as its parameter `state` becomes `ENABLED`.

### Description 
Disables a specific Plugin. If the Plugin is disabled, the Plugin cannot be used as its parameter `state` becomes `DISABLED`.

### Description 
Gets all version data of a specific Plugin from its Repository. The parameter `plugin_id` is used as an identifier of a Plugin to get version data.

### Description 
Gets a specific Plugin. Prints detailed information about the Plugin, including  `image`, `registry_url`, and `state`.

### Description 
Gets a list of all Plugins registered in a specific Repository. The parameter `repository_id` is used as an identifier of a Repository to get its list of Plugins. You can use a query to get a filtered list of Plugins.

requestBody.description: | Key | Description | Type | Required| |-------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------|-----------|-------| |repository_id||string|True| |domain_id||string|True| |query||Query|| |plugin_id||string|| |name||string|| |state|ENABLED, DISABLED |string|| |service_type||string|| |provider||string|| |registry_type|DOCKER_HUB, AWS_PRIVATE_ECR, HARBOR |string||

Default Example.value:
{
   "results": [
       {

           "registry_config": {},
           "capability": {},
           "template": {},

               "icon": "https://icon-url/icon.svg"
           },
           "repository_info": {

               "name": "Marketplace",
               "repository_type": "remote"
           },
           "domain_id": "domain-987654321098",
           "created_at": "2022-01-01T03:25:10.408Z",
           "updated_at": "2022-01-01T03:25:10.408Z"
       },
       {
           "plugin_id": "plugin-aws-hyperbilling-cost-datasource",
           "name": "AWS HyperBilling Cost Analysis Data Source",
           "image": "pyengine/plugin-aws-hyperbilling-cost-datasource",
           "registry_url": "registry.hub.docker.com",
           "state": "ENABLED",
           "service_type": "cost_analysis.DataSoruce",
           "registry_type": "DOCKER_HUB",
           "registry_config": {},
           "capability": {},
           "template": {},
           "labels": [],
           "tags": {},

post.description: ### Description

### Description 
Creates a new Schema. You must specify the parameters: `service_type`, `name`, and `schema`(data structure). With the parameter `domain_id`, you can choose whether you will create a Schema in `Local` or externally. The Schema created includes `repository_info`, information about where the resource is managed.

### Description 
Updates a specific Schema. You can make changes in Schema settings, including `name`, `schema`, `labels`, and `tags`.

### Description 
Deletes a specific Schema. You must specify the `name` of the Schema to delete, as the `name` is an identifier of Schema resources.

### Description 
Gets a specific Schema. You must specify the `name` of the Schema to get, as the `name` is an identifier of Schema resources. You can use the parameter `repository_id` to limit the scope of the method to a specific Repository.

### Description 
Gets a list of all Schemas in a specific Repository. The parameter `repository_id` is used as an identifier of a Repository to get its list of Schemas. You can use a query to get a filtered list of Schemas.
### Description
